snippet: Roads and other transportation projects, as well as sewers and waste disposal plants, were among the biggest recipients during the 12 months through October.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column examines Census Bureau report showing that federal, state and local government spent $271.1 billion on construction projects during 12 months through October, 0.3 percent more than in previous 12 months.
lead_paragraph: Roads and other transportation projects, as well as sewers and waste disposal plants, were among the biggest recipients during the 12 months through October.

headline.print_headline: Government Spending on Construction Edges Up
headline.main: Government Spending on Construction Edges Up
